judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT CHANDIGARH CWP No.7672 of 1994 Date of decision: 14.9.2012 M/s Rasulpur Bricks Udhyog .Petitioner Vs. The State of Haryana and others

.Respondents CORAM: HON BLE MR.JUSTICE GURMEET SINGH SANDHAWALIA ***** Present: Mr. B.R.Rana, Advocate for the petitioner. Mr. Saurabh Mohunta, DAG., Haryana for the respondents. ***** G.S.SANDHAWALIA, J, (Oral) Counsel for the petitioner states that there is no fresh instructions as to whether the petitioner is still in possession of the land in dispute. The dispute pertains to the lease and the cancellation of the Brick Kiln licence. The writ petition is of 1994. The lease vide resolution dated .2.1993 was for a period of three years upto 30.5.1996. Accordingly, it seems that the writ petition has been rendered infructuous by efflux of time and the same is disposed of as such. However, petitioner is at liberty to file an appropriate application in case lis still subsists.

.9.2012 (G.S.SANDHAWALIA) Pka JUDGE
